cyclone.name: CRISTOBAL
cyclone.current_location: about 155 miles WSW of Campeche, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Meandering in the southern Bay of Campeche through mid-week, then forecast to turn northward and lift toward the central Gulf Coast (Louisiana/Mississippi) late this week-end

weather_observation.watch_coast: Campeche to Puerto de Veracruz, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Campeche to Puerto de Veracruz, Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern Bay of Campeche coast and, by days 4-5, the north-central Gulf Coast from Texas/Louisiana line eastward to Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Only a very small (≈3%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds at the port late in the 5-day period
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at this time given the forecast track well east of the port
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer moisture plume could bring periods of heavy rain (2–4+ inches) late Saturday through Monday if the system stays on the west side of the forecast cone
weather_observation.other_hazards: Localized flooding in low-lying areas possible from heavy rain; otherwise, no significant hazards currently indicated
